title: Where to Find Google Hangouts (Google Chat) in Gmail

steps.title: Tap the Chat tab at the bottom of the Gmail app.
steps.content: Tap the Chat tab at the bottom of the Gmail app. In the Gmail app on your Android, iPhone, or iPad, just tap the chat bubble at the bottom to open Google Chat (formerly Hangouts). Here, you'll find all your chats–including old Hangouts–and the option to create new ones .

steps.title: Enable Google Chat if you don't see it.
steps.content: Enable Google Chat if you don't see it. If you don't see Google Chat, you need to enable it. Fortunately, enabling Google Chat is super easy on both Android and iOS: Android Tap the three-line menu ☰ at the top-left corner of Gmail. Tap Settings at the bottom. Select an account. Under "General," enable "Show the chat and spaces tab" next to the "Chat" option. [1] X Research source iPhone & iPad Tap the three-line menu ☰ at the top-left corner of Gmail. Tap Settings at the bottom. Under "Apps in Gmail," tap Chat . Tap the switch next to "Chat" to show the chat tab. Tap Done.

steps.title: Use the icon at the bottom to navigate Google Chat.
steps.content: Use the icon at the bottom to navigate Google Chat. You'll notice you have many more options than you did in Hangouts: On the Home tab, you'll find a list of all your chats and Spaces (dedicated group chats) on one page. On the Direct Message tab (the two overlapping chat bubbles), you'll see a list of private messages you've sent and received through Google Chat. On the Sections tab (the two bars), you'll find all the Spaces you've joined or created, as well as Chat apps you've added. Check out the Chat section of Google Workspace Marketplace to see what kinds of apps are available for Google Chat. [2] X Research source The Mentions tab (the @ symbol) lists all your mentions (tags) from Spaces. The Starred tab lists any messages you've starred.

steps.title: Tap the New Chat icon to create a new chat or space.
steps.content: Tap the New Chat icon to create a new chat or space. It's the chat bubble with a + symbol at the bottom-right corner of Google Chat. Here, you can search for the person you want to chat with and select them to start a conversation, or tap Create a space to create your own group chat.

steps.title: Click Chat in the left panel of Gmail.
steps.content: Click Chat in the left panel of Gmail. If you're using Gmail on your PC, Mac, or Chromebook, you can access Google Chat (formerly Hangouts) in Gmail. This opens Google Chat.

steps.title: Enable Google Chat if you don't see it.
steps.content: Enable Google Chat if you don't see it. If you don't see Google Chat, you need to enable it. You can enable it easily in your settings. Here's how: Click the gear icon at the top-right corner of your inbox. Click See all settings . Click the Chat and Meet tab. Select Google Chat next to "Chat." Click Save Changes . You should now see the chat icon in your left sidebar.

steps.title: Navigate Google Chat.
steps.content: Navigate Google Chat. When you're in Google Chat, you'll see a sidebar on the left with options like Home, Mentions, and Starred. The Home tab contains a list of your chats (including any chats you had going in Hangouts) and Spaces (group chats). The Mentions tab (the @ symbol) lists all your mentions (tags) from Spaces. The Starred tab lists any messages you've starred. No matter which tab you're in, you'll also see your direct messages in the left sidebar, and a list of Spaces you've joined or created.

steps.title: Click New chat to start chatting.
steps.content: Click New chat to start chatting. It's right above the shortcuts in the left sidebar. This gives you the option to search for a contact to chat with, create a Space (a group chat room), find apps to add to Google Chat, and more.

steps.title: What is Google Chat?
steps.content: What is Google Chat? Google Chat is a new and improved version of Google Hangouts, with added features like group chat rooms, direct messages, mentions, and more. You can access Google Chat through Gmail or by going to chat.google.com in a web browser.

steps.title: Does Gmail still have Hangouts?
steps.content: Does Gmail still have Hangouts? Hangouts went away in November 2022, but Google Chat offers many of the same features.

steps.title: How do I find my Hangouts in Gmail?
steps.content: How do I find my Hangouts in Gmail? Like email in Gmail, your old Hangouts conversations can be found in your archive. You can search for them using the search bar, or just tap the chat icon in Gmail to open Google Chat and scroll through your chat list–it includes your Hangouts conversations.

steps.title: How do I enable Google Chat on my phone?
steps.content: How do I enable Google Chat on my phone? You can enable it in the Gmail app. Tap the three-line menu and select Settings . On Android, select an account, then turn on "Show the chat and spaces tab." On iPhone or iPad, tap Chat , then toggle on the "Chat" switch.

steps.title: How do I call in Google Chat?
steps.content: How do I call in Google Chat? You can call someone from Google Chat from a direct message. Just open Google Chat and click or tap the Direct Messages tab (the two overlapping chat bubble icons) to view your DMs, then select the conversation with the person you want to call. Tap the video camera icon at the top-right to open the Call menu, and select either Chat audio or Chat video to place your call. [3] X Research source
